page.title: 18Walking the footpaths.
page.content: Last week we walked the footpaths to the west of the village. We crossed a stile at{Cae Garn,}a street at the northern end of the village,and followed the hedgerow across a field. Birds sang sweetly in the trees,cows grazed in the field and wild flowers carpetted the ground. After crossing a second field,we came to an old cottage called{Parc Bach.} The path turned south following a stream to a disused farm called {Drefach.} Here the path ended. Between Drefach and the village the path was removed, in the early '70s.,by open-cast mining.The land has been restored to its former state so we continued through lush fields,following the line of the old footpath to the southern end of the village. (Group C.) S.F.& C.W.
